info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Areas of fog continue to develop across the northern ranchlands of deep south Texas late tonight... Surface observations and satellite images indicate areas of fog...some locally dense...continue to develop across portions of the northern ranchlands of deep south Texas late tonight. Visibilities of 1 to 3 miles in general can be expected with isolated areas of dense fog reducing visibilities to a quarter of a mile. If the dense fog becomes more widespread later this morning then a Dense Fog Advisory will likely be issued for portions of deep south Texas early in the morning. Late night motorists should be aware of locally dense fog with visibility changing rapidly over short distances. Use low beam headlights and leave extra distance between your vehicle and others on the road.
